meanings.definition: The act or process of flowing out
meanings.sent1: The effluxion of water from the bottle was swift.
meanings.sent2: The effluxion of lava from the volcano was dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The effluxion of giggles from the classroom surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The effluxion of emotions from her heart was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The effluxion of colors from the painting made it come alive.

meanings.definition: The passing of time or the gradual development of something
meanings.sent1: The effluxion of hours seemed endless during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: The effluxion of days turned into weeks without him noticing.
meanings.sent3: The effluxion of jokes during the party kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The effluxion of ideas from her mind was like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The effluxion of memories from the old photograph brought tears to her eyes.
